Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Kyle Rittenhouse was allowed to walk away by the Kenosha police after the shooting incident.
Understate: The claim may understate the severity of the situation by not fully acknowledging the charges and crimes Kyle Rittenhouse is accused of.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to fully substantiate the assertion that the police "let an armed white supremacist walk right past them after shooting people."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the treatment of Kyle Rittenhouse by the police was directly comparable to the treatment of Jacob Blake, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the actions of the Kenosha police in relation to Kyle Rittenhouse, such as their assessment of the situation or their understanding of the events at the time.
